timeline.summary: On July 12, 2019, the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York issued a memo endorsement regarding the case of *USA v. Epstein* (Case Number 1:19-cr-00490-RMB). The endorsement, signed by Judge Richard M. Berman, denied a government request for an extension of time to review a response to a motion. The email originates from the NYSD ECF Pool and provides information about the electronic filing process and the document's metadata, including a digital stamp.

A U.S. Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent an email to Judge Berman regarding the case *U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein* (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The email included attachments of the Government’s supplemental submission, including a redacted and an unredacted version. Exhibits A, B, and C were attached; Exhibits A and C were publicly filed, while Exhibits B and C were requested to be filed under seal.

The U.S. Department of Justice, via the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, is responding to Jeffrey Epstein’s July 16, 2019 letter regarding an expired Austrian passport. The government disputes Epstein’s claim about the passport’s expiration, presenting evidence of numerous travel stamps indicating its use in countries like France, Spain, the UK, and Saudi Arabia in the 1980s. The government also points out that Epstein has not disclosed his citizenship or legal residency status outside of the United States.

On August 5, 2019, a “Form B” was filed on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein in the case of *United States of America v. Epstein* (Case Number 19-2221) before the Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit. The document was filed by Reid Weingarten and associates, and associated with CM/ECF.[2624204]. Electronic notification was sent to several individuals, including Donnell G. Bolden, Deputy Clerk. The document was stamped with a date and file number on August 5, 2019.

On August 5, 2019, a “Notice of Appearance for Additional or Substitute Counsel” was filed in the case of *United States of America v. Epstein* (Case Number 19-2221) before the Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit. The notice was filed on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein by CM/ECF and indicates the document was electronically mailed and stored in the notice cart for Quality Control and the Deputy Clerk. The document itself is titled “Epstein_MGW Notice of Appearance for Additional Counsel_final.pdf”.

On August 21, 2019, a Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported on interactions with an inmate, identified as “Epstein,” and a Facilities Manager. The Facilities Manager confirmed an inmate (likely Epstein) requested recreational time (“SHU rec”) and was taken to the roof by an officer between 6:00/6:30 and 10:30/11:00 AM. The manager also noted an inmate complaint about water leaking during “ion showers.” Evening watch staff provided newspapers delivered on August 20, 2019. Additionally, Bruce Barket filed a letter on ECF, prompting a request for a call from an Assistant U.S. Attorney.

Roberta Kaplan, of Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, filed a response to two letters from Defendants in the case *Doe v. Indyke, et al., 1:19-cv-08673-KPF* on November 5, 2019. Kyla Magun, an associate at the firm, sent the response as an attachment to Judge Failla. The response addressed ECF 19 and 20.

A law firm, Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, is representing Jane Doe in a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein and others (ECF 19-cv-08673). They are responding to a request from the defendants for a 30-day extension to respond to concerns regarding the related status of the case and document preservation. The firm opposes the extension, arguing that the cases share overlapping defendants, legal issues, and factual allegations. They highlight concerns about potential spoliation of evidence given the circumstances surrounding Epstein’s death and the complexities of the legal case. Additionally, they note that multiple related cases have been reassigned to the same magistrate judge.

On December 19, 2019, the U.S. Department of Justice, through the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, informed Judge Kenneth M. Karas about the defense’s request for video footage (the “Video”) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) from July 22-23, 2019, related to the case *United States v. Nicholas Tartaglione*. The Government confirmed the video was preserved and is in the process of obtaining a copy to provide to defense counsel for review at the United States Attorney's Office.

A motion to compel discovery was filed in the case of USA v. Michael Thomas, et al. by the Law Offices of Montell Figgins, LLC. The motion, attached as "Michael Thomas - Motion to Compel Discovery and Exhibits.PDF," was also filed via ECF. The email details the filing and provides contact information for the law office.

The Law Offices of Montell Figgins, LLC sent a motion to compel discovery, filed by Defendant Michael Thomas, in the case of USA v. Michael Thomas, et al. The motion was refiled and also filed via ECF. The email includes a standard confidentiality notice.

On July 6, 2020, Lawrence A. Vogelman electronically filed a Notice of Attorney Appearance for Ghislaine Maxwell in Case 1:20-mj-00132-AJ, USA v. Maxwell, with the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire. The notice was generated by the CM/ECF system and included a stamp confirming the electronic filing date and associated file numbers (EFTA00010372 and EFTA00010373).  The email correspondence details the automatic generation of the notification and outlines the court's policy regarding free electronic copies for attorneys of record and parties.

On July 6, 2020, a document was filed with the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire concerning the case USA v. Maxwell (Case Number 1:20-mj-00132-AJ). The document details that Ghislaine Maxwell has been committed to the District of Southern District of New York. The filing was made on July 2, 2020, and was ordered by Magistrate Judge Andrea K. Johnstone. Electronic notification was sent to USANH.ECFCriminal and USANH.ECFDocket@usdoj.gov.

Lawrence A. Vogelman, attorney #10280, appeared as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in Case 1:20-mj-00132-AJ, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The appearance was filed on July 6, 2020, and documented through a certificate of service indicating electronic service via the court’s CM/ECF system.

On July 10, 2020, an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York requested docketing of the superseding indictment in the case of *US v. Maxwell* (S1 20 Cr. 330 (AN)). The request followed receipt of a color scan of the signed indictment from the United States Attorney's Office.  A previous email, dated July 8, 2020, indicated the grand jury return for the same case had been provided to Judge Nathan and the superseding indictment was unsealed.  The document is associated with EFTA00010965 and EFTA00010966.

Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, forwarded a Motion to Stay filed by Maxwell’s counsel regarding case 2d Cir. 20-02413 (v. Maxwell). The motion was filed on July 30, 2020, and service was completed by CM/ECF. The motion was entered into the docket on July 30, 2020, on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell. The email chain originated from ECFdocuments@pacerpro.com.

On September 16, 2020, a So-Ordered Scheduling Notification was filed in case number 20-3061, United States of America v. Maxwell. The notification set the Appellant Ghislaine Maxwell’s Brief due date as October 22, 2020, and the Joint Appendix due date as the same date.  The notification was electronically mailed to T Gee, Laura Menninger, Adam Wetter, Gerard Whidbee, and Quality Control 1. The document is identified as So_ordered_sched_notification and has a file name /opt/ACECF/live/forms/GerardWhidbee_203061_2932112_So_Ordered_sched_notification_apt_308.pdf with an electronic stamp dated September 16, 2020. Document EFTA00025379 is also associated with this transaction.

On September 24, 2020, a motion to seal a document was filed in the case of United States of America v. Maxwell (Case Number 20-3061) by Ghislaine Maxwell. The motion was filed electronically via CM/ECF and associated with document “2020.09.24 Motion for Leave to File Under Seal.pdf”. The court’s Notice of Docket Activity indicates electronic notification was sent to Gerard Whidbee, Deputy Clerk, and the document is stamped with a date of September 24, 2020, and file number 2938282-0. The document’s file identifier is EFTA00028066.

This document is an appendix filed in the case of *United States of America v. Maxwell* (Case 20-3061) from the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. The email, sent on September 24, 2020, includes a file named "20-3061_United_States_of America_v._Maxwell2Appendix_FILED". The sender is cmecf@ca2.uscourts.gov.

On September 24, 2020, an appendix, volume 2 of 2, pages 124-314, was filed in the case of United States of America v. Maxwell (Case Number 20-3061) on behalf of Appellant Ghislaine Maxwell. The document was filed by CMIECF and stamped with a date and file number. It was designated as "APPENDIX FILED."

On September 28, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell filed an opposition to a motion to dismiss in the case of United States of America v. Maxwell (Case Number 20-3061) with the 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals. The document, titled “Response to Mot to Dismiss,” was filed by CMIECF. The electronic document was stamped on September 28, 2020, and associated with docket number 2940206.

On October 8, 2020, a motion to seal a document was filed in the case of United States of America v. Maxwell (Case Number 20-3061) by Ghislaine Maxwell. The motion was filed through CM/ECF and associated with the document "2020.10.08 Motion for Leave to File RB Under Seal.pdf". The notice of docket activity was electronically mailed to various U.S. Department of Justice personnel and the Deputy Clerk. The document was stamped with an electronic stamp on October 8, 2020.

Maxwell’s appeal regarding a protective order modification was dismissed on jurisdictional grounds. A summary order was filed by the US Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit, dismissing the case (United States of America v. Maxwell, Case Number 20-3061). The court affirmed the unsealing of Maxwell’s deposition and other documents.  Electronic copies of the summary order and itemized bills of cost were filed and distributed to recipients via ACECF.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email attachment, a courtesy copy of an ECF filing, regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (MN). The attachment was a .htm file titled "Maxwell_Reply_to_90-day_conditions.pdf".

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email to [REDACTED], Christian, and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a courtesy copy of an ECF filing, specifically a letter concerning MDC conditions (“MDC Conditions_Letter_2-16_FINAL.pdf”) and a related HTML document (“ATT00001.htm”).

An Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York is reviewing a privilege log (SDFL_privilege_Iog.pdf) submitted by the defense in a case involving the “NPA.” The log contains an entry for a file folder and an attorney with an unknown name (“”) who is not found through searches or NY attorney registration databases. The Assistant U.S. Attorney is seeking suggestions on how to investigate this individual.

An email was sent from Bobbi C. Sternheim to multiple recipients, including IMSYS and Christian Everdell, on February 23, 2021. The email attached a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) related to the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). The email contained a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information. The document referenced is MAXWELL_BAIL_APPLICATION_with_EXHIBIT_2-23-17.pdf.

Email correspondence regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*.  Multiple individuals, including Bobbi C. Sternheim, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Christian Everdell, exchanged emails related to an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing concerning a bail application for Maxwell. The email chain indicates a previous unsuccessful attempt (“third time’s the charm”) related to the case.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (MAXWELL_BAIL_APPLICATION_with_EXHIBIT_2-23-17.pdf) related to the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to several recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca. The email contains a confidentiality and privilege disclaimer.

The Government of the Southern District of New York submitted an omnibus memorandum of law in opposition to the defense’s pretrial motions in the case of *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The memorandum, along with supporting exhibits and a cover letter, were initially requested to be accepted temporarily under seal.

Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq., sent an email to Nathan NYSD Chambers and others, including Christian Everdell and Laura Menninger, regarding an unredacted version of the Reply Memorandum In Support of Ms. Maxwell’s pending bail application in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email was attached to a cover letter and submitted pursuant to Rule 2(8) of the court's individual rules. Sternheim’s firm was providing the document to the court and government.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an unredacted version of the Reply Memorandum In Support of Ms. Maxwell’s pending bail application to Nathan Chambers, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca in connection with the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The submission was provided pursuant to Rule 2(8) of the court’s individual rules.

Indyke, Richard D. Kahn, and Ghislaine Maxwell, alleging sexual assault, battery, emotional distress, and false imprisonment. *   **Dismissal Motion:** Doe moved to dismiss the case under Rule 41(a)(2) of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, citing the ongoing criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. *   **Criminal Prosecution:** Maxwell is being prosecuted in the Southern District of New York for related criminal charges (ECF No. 20-CR-330). *   **Victims’ Compensation Program:** The Epstein Estate established a compensation program for victims, and Doe accepted an offer, requiring dismissal with prejudice. *   **Stipulation and Conditions:** To achieve dismissal, Doe sought to have the case dismissed with prejudice under the terms of a partially executed stipulation. However, Maxwell objected and proposed additional conditions regarding attorney’s fees, costs, and access to the release agreement. *   **Maxwell’s Objections:** Maxwell argued that the stipulation regarding fees and costs was problematic and that she should be allowed to seek fees as the prevailing party and to sue for abuse of process. She also requested a copy of the unredacted release agreement. *   **Court’s Order:** The Court granted the motion to dismiss with prejudice, subject to the proposed conditions – modification of the fee and cost provision, allowing Maxwell to seek fees as the prevailing party, and providing her with the unredacted release. The parties were given until March 19, 2021, to indicate their agreement.

The email, dated March 23, 2021, from the United States Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York to multiple recipients, concerns opposition to defense motions in the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 CR. 330). It includes attachments: a letter regarding redactions filed on the Electronic Case File (ECF), a proposed redaction memorandum of law, and proposed redactions to Exhibit 11.

David Oscar Markus is representing Ghislaine Maxwell’s appeal regarding the denial of her bail application in *U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell*. He requests access to unredacted docket entries 4, 18, 22, 97, 100, 103, 106, 159, 160, 165, 171, and 169 to prepare the appeal. The Assistant U.S. Attorney acknowledges Markus’s role and refers to an existing protective order (ECF No. 36) binding on all counsel. The government initially opposes Maxwell’s motion and intends to file a response.

On April 1, 2021, the United States of America v. Maxwell case (Case Number 21-770) had a “Notice of Appearance for Additional or Substitute Counsel” filed on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell. The notice was filed by CWECF and documented as document EFTA00027869. The document was electronically stamped on April 1, 2021, and associated with file numbers 3068185-0.

On April 1, 2021, a “Defective Document” – a motion for bail – was filed in case number 21-58, United States of America v. Maxwell, on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell. The document was filed by the Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit.  The document was associated with the electronic file names /opt/ACECF/live/formsi 158_3068308 Defective_Document_Notice_142.pdf and was stamped with an electronic date and file number. The document was sent to recipients EFTA00027357 and EFTA00027358.

On April 5, 2021, an “Acknowledgment and Notice of Appearance” was filed in case number 21-770, United States of America v. Maxwell, on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell. The document was filed by CMIECF and associated with docket number [3070408-0]. Electronic notifications were sent to David Oscar Markus, Assistant U.S. Attorney, and the Deputy Clerk. The document’s original filename was “Acknowledgment and Notice of Appearance Form 4.5.21.pdf”. The document was stamped on April 5, 2021, with the file identifiers EFTA00015720 and EFTA00015721.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email to multiple recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuc, providing a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) regarding U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (ALN)). The attached documents include a letter dated April 6th, 2021.

Law Clerk Nathan Chambers responded to David Oscar Markus’s request for permission to bring electronic devices into the courthouse for the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20-Cr-330). Chambers stated that all communications with Judge Nathan must be docketed on ECF unless a request to seal is made, and Judge Nathan does not issue electronic device orders for attorneys who haven’t appeared on ECF. He provided a link to the form for the order authorizing electronic devices. Markus, representing Ghislaine Maxwell, requested permission to bring his cell phone and laptop to the April 23rd arraignment and offered to provide a proposed order.

The document is a legal case file related to the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (Case Number 21-58). It was retrieved on April 14, 2021. Key events include a Notice of Hearing Date Acknowledgment filed by Maxwell’s counsel, a motion to seal a document filed by the USA, an opposition to that motion filed by the USA, and a motion order granting the seal. All filings were made via CM/ECF.

On April 15, 2021, a Certificate of Service, including an Affirmation in Support of Motion to Be Relieved As Appellate Counsel, was filed in the case of United States of America v. Maxwell (Case Number 21-58) before the Court of Appeals, 2nd Circuit. The document was filed electronically via CM/ECF and electronically mailed to Mr. Assistant U.S. Attorney, Ms. Bobbi C. Stemheim, Deputy Clerk, and Quality Control 1. The document’s electronic file identifier is EFTA00027563.

The email correspondence concerns redactions proposed by the United States Government for the defense's reply briefs and exhibits in the case *US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*. Two exhibits detailing the Government’s proposed redactions are attached to the email. The email originates from the United States Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email with a courtesy copy of an ECF filing regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) to [REDACTED], Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin er, and Jeff Pagliuca. The attachment was a letter titled “Letter_to_Court_re-_42421.pdf”.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (“U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)”) to multiple recipients, including [REDACTED] and [REDACTED], via email. The email attached a letter regarding sleep deprivation (“Letter re- Sleep Deprivation-4-29-4”) and included a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, outlining remote work procedures due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

On April 29, 2021, Ori from (USANYS) contacted individuals regarding a request from Maxwell’s counsel challenging the court’s order regarding Ms. Maxwell’s sleeping conditions, specifically the 15-minute light surveillance. Bobbi Sternheim attached a courtesy copy of a filed ECF concerning the matter. The communication included a Covid-19 notice detailing the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim’s remote operations during the pandemic.

A letter from MDC legal counsel was sent to Nathan NYSD Chambers in response to the Court's April 29, 2021 Order in the case of *US v. Maxwell*. The letter was not filed on ECF due to MDC’s status as a non-party, but the Government has no objection to its public docketing. The letter is attached.

Bobbi sent a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) to [REDACTED] and [REDACTED]. The ECF filing, titled "Letter_re-fileep_Deprivation-4-29-21.pdf," is attached. Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin er, and Jeff Pagliuca are included in the "Cc:" field.

A letter was filed by Maxwell’s counsel regarding sleep deprivation during her detention in the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The letter requests the court order the MDC to cease 15-minute light surveillance or justify the disruptive flashlight surveillance. Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq., sent a courtesy copy of the ECF filing. The email includes a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information contained within the message and attached documents.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email attachment, a courtesy copy of the ECF filing in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case Number S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Mennin. The attachment is named Reply_to_Dkt_270.pdf and ATT00001.htm.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email to [REDACTED] on May 7, 2021, forwarding a document from Maxwell’s attorneys related to the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing and a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information contained within the message and attachments. Laura Menninger provided Covid-19 related office updates.

On May 17, 2021, a Motion for bail was filed on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell in case number 21-770, United States of America v. Maxwell. The motion was filed electronically through CM/ECF and associated with documents titled "Motion for Reconsideration4.pdf" and "Appendix to the Renewed Motion for Reconsideration4.pdf."  Notice of the filing was sent to multiple legal representatives, including Bobbi C. Stemheim, David Oscar Markus, and Khadijah Y Young. The documents were stamped with an electronic date and file number.

The United States Attorney’s Office submitted a letter requesting redactions to Exhibit C of a defendant’s memorandum in support of supplemental pre-trial motions. The letter and the Government’s proposed redactions were attached to the email. The case is *US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*.

A correspondence chain regarding the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) is documented. The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent an email to counsel, including a letter from the Government detailing defendant Maxwell’s conditions of confinement at the MDC. The Government submitted the letter temporarily under seal, awaiting defense input regarding potential redactions. Bobbi Sternheim, an attorney, provided a courtesy copy of the electronic filing (ECF) and included a note about their remote work arrangements due to COVID-19.

Maxwell*. Christian Everdell has informed the team that no redactions are being proposed. The court ordered the parties to file the joint letter by June 30, 2021, if no redactions are sought. The document is an electronic filing from the Southern District of New York Court.

Bobbi Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of ECF filing related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN) to several recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The filing is attached as Reply_to_Order_Dkt_312.pdf and ATT00001.htm.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email with a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The ECF filing, attached as Letter_re_VICs_8-18-18.pdf and ATT00001.htm, was sent to recipients including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.

This email, dated October 13, 2021, concerns a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire related to the case *US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN)*. The email is sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] and includes attachments: a Notice of Motion - Voir Dire, a juror questionnaire, and a voir dire document. The sender provides courtesy copies of ECF filings.

On October 14, 2021, Bobbi Sternheim’s Law Offices filed a courtesy copy of an ECF filing related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to multiple recipients including [REDACTED], Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The filing was sent from [REDACTED] to fla(USANYS) (USANYS).

v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN).” *   A draft response letter was prepared and needs review by MDC (likely a specific legal team or department) and Sophia. *   There’s a request to discuss specific language regarding Judge Nathan’s deadlines. *   The team is seeking clarification on a complex issue related to delivered materials and the defense’s footnote 1. *   They’ve contacted the BOP (Bureau of Prisons) to schedule a call. *   Bobbi Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing. *   There's a deadline of 5 PM on October 15, 2021, for the response.

On October 15, 2021, Bobbi Sternheim sent a response to a case, U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), attaching a defense’s letter reply and a judge’s decision. The judge’s decision stated an expectation that defendants in pre-trial postures like GM will receive legal mail within one business day, allowing for renewal of the request if delays occur. Sternheim also provided a courtesy copy of the ECF filing and updated her contact information.

A communication chain regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)* is being coordinated. Judge Nathan requested a response to a letter from Bobbi Sternheim by 5 pm on October 15, 2021. Efforts were made to contact the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) to schedule a call. Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing that evening, involving multiple legal counsel including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and the sender's organization, Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

On October 15, 2021, an email chain discusses a response to a U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). A draft response with highlighted language was prepared and intended for review by the MDC.  There was discussion about deleting specific sentences and avoiding engagement with a defense footnote regarding material volumes. Judge Nathan ordered a response by 5 PM that day. Bobbi Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing that evening. A letter was being sent to the court regarding legal mail.

On October 29, 2021, a response was filed in the USA v. Maxwell case (1:20-cr-00330-AJN) regarding a motion in limine. The response, filed by Jeffrey Pagliuca, includes several exhibits filed under seal (A-I). The filing was automatically generated through the NYSD ECF Pool and was sent to numerous parties involved in the case, including attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell and the U.S. Department of Justice. The document also provides information about the electronic filing system and associated fees.

An email chain, dated November 3, 2021, discusses a U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email, sent by Bobbi C. Sternheim, provides a courtesy copy of an Electronic Filing (ECF) related to the case, specifically a disclosure of juror names to counsel. The email includes Bobbi Sternheim's updated contact information and a confidentiality disclaimer.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email on November 3, 2021, to multiple recipients including Christian Everdel, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The email contained a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to “U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN)” and a PDF document titled “Disclosure of Juror Names to Counsel Only upon completion of Questionnaire.” Sternheim also reiterated her new office address and preferred email address within the email.

Bobbi Sternheini sent an external email regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell S2* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (Defense_Reply_to_Dkt_350.pdf; ATT00001.htm) and was sent to Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca.

On November 18, 2021, the Southern District of New York’s Assistant United States Attorney requested the removal of Dkt. No. 453 due to a redaction error. The Government had previously added a redaction to the document, specifically covering the name of a witness on page 11. A corrected version was to be submitted by the Chambers of Alison J. Nathan, and the Clerks Office was cautioned to temporarily remove the filing from ECF while the correction was prepared.  The email chain involved Chambers, the Assistant United States Attorney, and the Clerks Office.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email forwarding a response to government voir dire opposition in the case of *U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*. The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing and updated contact information for Sternheim. The email contained a confidentiality disclaimer regarding the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

Bobbi Sternhei sent an external email regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a courtesy copy of an ECF filing titled "Response_to_Govt_voir dire_opposition.pdf" and an HTML document (ATT00001.htm). Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca were included in the “To” field.

The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent motions in limine regarding the case *US v. Maxwell*, case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and others. The motions request temporary acceptance under seal, along with attached documents including redacted versions of government filings related to the case.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email to multiple recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca, providing a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to the case *US v. Maxwell 52 20 Cr 330 (AJN)*. The email includes her updated contact information and a standard confidentiality disclaimer.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an external email to Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the filing “10-27 It to Court.pdf” in the case US v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr 330 (MN). The email included a courtesy copy of the ECF filing.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an external email to multiple recipients regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing and her updated contact information. It also contained a standard disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information within the message and attached documents. A redaction was noted on page 1.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent an unredacted Request to Charge, Exhibit A, and a verdict sheet related to the case of *US v. Maxwell* to Nathan NYSD Chambers and others. The Government intends to file a redacted version of the Request to Charge and a verdict sheet on the Electronic Case File (ECF). The Government is seeking limited redactions to the Request to Charge, while the defense is requesting the sealing of Exhibit A. A Word version of the Request to Charge was also provided for the court's convenience.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an external email to multiple recipients regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an Electronic Filed Communication (ECF) filing and her updated contact information. The email also contained a standard confidentiality and disclaimer notice regarding the contents of the message and attached documents.

Bobbi C. Sternheim is sending a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (Docket 423) related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2. She provides her updated contact information: ternheim and confirms the confidential and privileged nature of the message and attached documents. The document is labeled EFTA00010016.

Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq., sent courtesy copies of electronic filings related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The filings included a Bail Application and disclosures regarding juror names. Sternheim provided her updated office address and email address in the communications. The documents contained confidentiality and privilege notices.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email to multiple recipients regarding the US v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The email includes a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case Filing (ECF) document and updates her contact information. It also contains a standard confidentiality and disclaimer notice regarding the information within the email and attached documents.

The United States Government is submitting a memorandum in support of detention in the case of *United States v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). A copy is being sent to Judge Nathan, defense counsel, and the presiding Magistrate Judge in the District of New Hampshire. The memorandum was generated on December 25, 2025.

A letter from MDC legal counsel regarding the case *US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)* was sent to Judge Nathan NYSD Chambers. The letter was not filed on the Electronic Case File (ECF) because MDC is not a party to the case, but the government has no objection to its public docketing. The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent the letter.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a courtesy copy of an ECF filing, specifically a response to the MDC’s letter, concerning Ghislaine Maxwell (Case 02879-509). The email included attachments: GM RESPONSE_TO_MDC_LEGAL.pdf and ATT00001.htm.
